summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that two documents (3505-043 and 3505-044) are true and accurate copies of a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, and that these documents and the stipulation itself (marked as Government Exhibit 1007) may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken on this date in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is referenced as documents 3505-043 and 3505-044.

events.title: Filing of Evidence Stipulation
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate in November 2021 that the 2009 deposition transcript and the stipulation itself may be received as evidence at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: The document is a formal court stipulation agreeing that a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, is authentic and can be used as evidence.
The deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, years before Ghislaine Maxwell's 2021 trial.
The stipulation is marked as 'Government Exhibit 1007' for the trial.
Ghislaine Maxwell is represented by a team of four attorneys: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time of this filing was Damian Williams.
